Why is my laptop overheating so much?
How to stop my laptop from overheating
What to Do if Your Laptop Is Overheating?
My laptop's getting overheated. What should I do about it?
Ways To Deal With Your Overheating Laptop
What is causing my laptop to overheat so much?
How can I keep my laptop from getting too hot?
How can I keep my laptop from heating up?
How can I keep my laptop from burning up?
How can I avoid my laptop from getting hot?
How can I prevent my laptop from overheating?
What Should You Do If Your Laptop Overheats?
What Should You Do If Your Computer Overheats?
What Should You Do If Your Computer Heats up?
What Should You Do If Your Computer Gets very hot?
What Should You Do If Your Computer Gets too hot?
My laptop is getting too hot. What should I do in this situation?
My laptop is heating up. What can I do in this situation?
My laptop is overheating. What can I do in this scenario?
responses: Change your laptop's power settings from High Performance to a Balanced or Power Saver plan. This tweak will tell the system only to use the power required to run your applications rather than always using the maximum processor speed. If you need to play games or other intensive work, you can switch back to the high-performance plan as required. This can be done by customising power plan from your settings
Use dust remover spray to clean the laptop's vents. Dust accumulates in the laptop's fan ventsâ€”a problem quickly solved with a can of compressed air.
Use a laptop cooling pad that has fans. Laptop pads have vents that can increase the airflow around your laptop, but a fan is the best way to go for more substantial cooling needs.
Shut down your computer when it's not in use, especially when you are not at home.

Most manufacturers offer an installation file that updates BIOS files automatically, which often address heat management. Just make sure that your notebook is connected to the power supply when updating the BIOS.

How to Improve My Painfully slow Laptop
How to Improve My Stagnant Pc
My PC is quite sluggish.
My Laptop is quite laggy.
My Laptop is very clunky.
responses: Scan Your laptop for any types of malware, virus attacks.
Close Unused Apps and Tabs or unused tabs in browsers
Limit how many apps start automatically when you boot up your computer. Too many means slow startups and lacklustre performance.
Free up some disk space or try upgrading your components.
Check if all drivers are upto date. If not update all drivers.

patterns: How to troubleshoot a faulty laptop screen
How do I fix my laptop screen without replacing it?
My laptop screen is damaged. What should I do?
How to Repair a Faulty Laptop Display
How to Fix a Defective Laptop Display
How to Restore a Leaky Laptop Display
How do I fix a Leaky Laptop Display
How do I fix a Flawed Laptop Display
How can I repair my laptop screen without having to replace it?
How can I fix my computer monitor without replacing it?
How can I restore my computer monitor without replacing it?
How do I repair my screen without having to replace it?
My laptop's screen has been shattered. So, what should I do now?
responses: Update your graphics driver. An outdated graphics driver could prevent the screen from displaying correctly.
You may also try updating the BIOS, as it could also be the source of the problem.

Perform a hard reset. Performing a hard reset is not the same as factory resetting your HP laptop. The hard reset should not clear any of your data from your computer, but it could clear out any driver or firmware errors that might be happening.
Reset the RAM. If you find you have a bad memory card, you can pick up and install a new stick of RAM to get your display going again.

Remove the main battery in the laptop or tablet and try using AC power only. Yes, it's perfectly fine to run your portable computer without the battery installed. Also Carefully inspect the power receptacle on the laptop or tablet for damage. Check for broken/bent pins and bits of debris that might be preventing the computer from getting power and charging the battery.

How do I fix my touchpad that isn't responding?

How come the touchpad on my laptop isn't working?
How come the touchpad on my pc isn't working?
How come the touchpad on my pc is still not working?
How come the touchpad on my computer is still not working?
responses: Confirm that the trackpad is connected correctly. If you use a touchpad that connects through USB, check that both ends of the connecting cable are fully plugged in.
Remove and reconnect the touchpad. Unplugging and reconnecting the touchpad may fix connection issues.
Restart the device. Restarting a computer, laptop, or tablet can often fix problems, including a touchpad that isn't working properly.
Update device drivers. Sometimes you need to update a device driver to make it more compatible with the hardware and operating system

Enable Touchpad in Settings. This varies by device, but in general, to check if the touchpad has been disabled in Windows and turn it back on, open Settings, select Devices > Touchpad, and make sure the switch is set to On.

5 Best Ways to Fix Screen Flickering on Windows 10

In Windows, fix screen flickering
In Windows, fix screen flashing

In Pc, repair screen flicker
How to Get Rid of Flickering and Flashing on Your Screen
What to Do to get Rid of Flickering and Flashing on Your Display
What to Do to get Rid of Flickering and Flashing on My Display
When I use my laptop, my eyes hurt.
When I use my computer, my eyes hurt.
When I use my computer, my head hurts.
My laptop's screen flashes excessively
My laptop's screen flashes abnormally
My computer's screen flashes abnormally
responses: Check to see whether the Task Manager flickers. Turn your computer on, and wait for the desktop to load.
Set the Correct Refresh Rate. Check the refresh rate setting on your computer and verify it matches the monitor's refresh rate
Update your graphics driver. Check for any available updates for your graphics driver, and install them.
Check for known problem apps and stop any app you think is causing this crash.
Attempt a system restore. Think about when you first noticed the screen flickering, and then check to see if you have a system restore point from before that day.

patterns: Fix sound problems
How to Fix Audio Not Working On Your Laptop
Laptop Speakers Not Working
What to do if my laptop's sound isn't working
Unable to hear anything from my laptop or pc
Fix the sound issues
Fix my pc's sound issues
How to Fix Your Laptop's Audio Problem
How Do I Fix My Laptop's Audio Problem?
How Would I Fix My Computer's Audio Issue?
The Speakers on My Laptop Aren't Working
The Speakers of My Computer Aren't Working
The Speakers of My Computer Aren't Functioning
What should I do if the sound on my laptop stops working?
What should I do if the sound on my computer stops functioning?
What should I do if the audio on my computer stops functioning?
I can't hear anything from my laptop or computer.
I can't hear anything at all from my laptop.
responses: Make sure your sound isn't muted. Laptops often include a mute button or shortcut you may have accidentally pushed, and you can also mute by clicking the speaker icon in the Windows system tray.

Try a set of headphones. Plug in a set of headphones or earbuds if you have them handy, and try to borrow a set if you don't. If you hear sound from your headphones, then there is either a problem with the software or driver responsible for switching outputs, or there is a physical problem with your laptop speakers.

Make sure the audio sensor isn't stuck. Laptops use a sensor to tell whether or not you have plugged headphones into the audio jack. If your computer thinks headphones are plugged in even when they aren't, it won't send sound to the speakers. If the problem is your audio input sensor, you will have to take your laptop in for service.
Check your playback device. Ensure that speakers are set as playback device. If any other device is set as the playback device change it back and try again.

Run the sound trouble-shooter. The built-in Windows sound trouble-shooter checks and fixes a lot of problems automatically. To run the sound troubleshooter, right-click the speaker icon in the system tray, click troubleshoot sound problems, then follow the on-screen prompts once the troubleshooter has appeared.

patterns: Why do some keys on my laptop keyboard not work?
How do I fix unresponsive keyboard keys?
Laptop keyboard not working?
How to Fix Laptop Keyboard When It Stops Working
How come some of the keys on my laptop keyboard aren't working?
How come some of the keys on my computer keyboard aren't operating?
Why a few of the buttons on my key board aren't operating?
Why come a few of the buttons on my key board aren't working?
How can I fix keyboard keys that aren't responding?
How do I fix keyboard that isn't responding?
The keyboard on my laptop isn't working.
The keyboard on my computer isn't working.
The keyboard on my laptop is not working.
The keyboard on my computer is not working.
The keyboard on my notebook is not working.
How to Restore the Functioning of a Laptop Keyboard
responses: Restart your computer. Occasionally, errors can happen in drivers, firmware, or software that will clear out when you restart your computer. Once you've restarted, check your keyboard to see if it is responding.
Unlock your keyboard. It's easy to trigger the shortcut to lock keyboard accidentally, so even if you don't think you've locked the keyboard, press and hold the right Shift key for 8 seconds.
Turn off Cortana. Despite being useful, Cortana can sometimes interfere with other functions on your laptop. Try disabling it to see if it gets your keyboard working again.
Run Windows Troubleshooter. Run the troubleshooter, and work through any suggestions it returns.

Disable other input methods. The windows Collaborative Translation Framework (CtfMon.exe) is designed to allow multiple input types, including a keyboard, touch, and stylus. However, it can also interfere with your keyboard. Try disabling ctfmon.exe to see if that might make your system default back to the keyboard.

patterns: How to Fix a Computer That Turns On and Then Off
Why does my computer power on and then immediately turns off
PC turns ON and then OFF in a matter of seconds
How to Troubleshoot a Computer That Turns On and Off
How to Troubleshoot a Laptop Which Goes On and Off
How to Troubleshoot a Pc Which Turns On and Off
What causes my computer to switch on and then turn off?
What causes my computer to turn on and then switch off?
What causes my computer to power on and then power off?
What causes my laptop to power on and then power off?
In a matter of seconds, the computer turns on and then turns off.
In a matter of seconds, the laptop turns on and then turns off.
responses: Troubleshoot the cause of the beep code, assuming you're lucky enough to hear one. A beep code will give you an excellent idea of exactly where to look for the cause of your computer turning off.
Make sure you're keeping the computer cool enough, or it might overheat to the point that it shuts down.
Test your power supply. Just because your laptop came on for a few moments doesn't mean that the power supply unit in your computer is working correctly.
Reseat everything inside of your computer. Reseating will re-establish all of the connections.
Start your PC with essential hardware only. The purpose here is to remove as much hardware as possible while still maintaining your computer's ability to power on.

patterns: How to Fix a Windows Blue Screen of Death
How to deal with Blue Screen of Death woes in Windows
My pc or laptop is showing a blue screen.
Recover from BSOD
How to Recover from a Blue Screen of Death in Windows
How to Return from a Blue Screen of Death in Windows
How to Handle the Blue Screen of Death in Windows
There's a blue screen on my laptop.
There's a blank screen on my laptop.
There's a blank screen on my computer.
There's a blank screen on my pc.
There's a blue screen on my notebook.
responses: The most important Blue Screen of Death troubleshooting step you can take is to ask yourself what you did just before the device stopped working. Undo the change you made and test again for the STOP Error. Try updating BIOS again.
Check that there's enough free hard drive space where Windows is being installed.
Scan your computer for malware and viruses. Some viruses can cause a Blue Screen of Death, especially ones that infect the master boot record (MBR) or boot sector.
Check for and install all available Windows service packs and updates.
Return hardware settings to default in Device Manager and update all the necessary hardware drivers.

patterns: What to do when your laptop battery won't charge
Why the battery is not charging when it is plugged in?
How to Fix a Laptop That Won't Charge
laptop Plugged In but not Charging
How to deal with a laptop battery that won't charge
How to deal with a computer battery which won't charge
How come the battery doesn't charge when it's plugged in?
How come the battery doesn't start charging when it's plugged in?
How to Repair a Non-Charging Laptop
How to Recharge a Laptop That Isn't Charging
How to Charge a Laptop That Isn't Charging
It's plugged in, but it's not charging
My laptop is plugged in, but it isn't charging.
My pc is plugged in, but it's not charging.
This pc is connected, but it's not charging.
responses: Check the wattage of the charger that came with your laptopâ€”if it came with a 45W charger, you'll probably want to stick with a 45W charger (or higher) to power it, and so on. A lower-wattage charger might keep the battery from draining while you use it, but it won't be enough to charge it any higher.

You may even find that your system shuts down to prevent overheating a battery and causing a fire. Turn the system off, give it some time to cool down, and take a moment to make sure the air vents are free of dust and unobstructed by blankets.

Open the Start menu and search for "Device Manager." Under Batteries, you should see a few items: usually one for the charger and one listed as Microsoft ACPI Compliant Control Method Battery, though there may be others. Right-click each item and choose Update Driver.
Try changing the adapter and check if the battery gets charged up using a different adapter.

First, check the integrity of the battery. If your laptop comes with a removable battery, take it out, and hold the power button down for about 15 seconds to drain any residual power from the device. Then, with the battery still removed, plug in the power cable and turn the laptop on. If the laptop powers on properly, that means the power adapter is working properly and the problem is likely a bum battery. You can always re-install the battery and try againâ€”maybe the battery was just poorly seated.

If your computer won't start in safe mode, follow these steps.
Hotfix cannot enter safe mode on Windows 10
How to fix a computer that doesn't boot in safe mode
responses: Try to start Windows in every startup method available.

Repair your Windows installation. The most common reason for Windows to continuously return you to the Startup Settings or Advanced Boot Options menu is because one or more important Windows files are damaged or missing.
Perform a System Restore from Advanced Startup Options or System Recovery Options, depending on your version of Windows, to undo recent changes.

Use the System File Checker command to repair protected Windows files. A damaged operating system-related file could be preventing you from getting past the Startup Settings or Advanced Boot Options menu, and the sfc command could fix the problem.
Test RAM and Hard drive which if test found some error upgrade or replace the needy.

Other devices can connect to Wi-Fi, however my laptop is unable to recognise or join to the network.
Check your Wi-Fi connection for issues.
responses: Reboot your Laptop and try connecting to a different wifi channel.
Reset your Wi-Fi driver. Doing this will clear the network cache and hopefully remove any connection errors.
Update your Wi-Fi driver. Network connection issues often result from outdated Wi-Fi drivers, and an update can resolve this.

Release and renew your IP address. You'll do this using the IPCONFIG command, which will drop any IP address your router has registered for your device and create a new one. It could clear any issues your router may have in allowing the connection from your old IP address.
Run the network troubleshooter and also disable any antivirus or firewall software.

patterns: How to Fix Corrupted Files
How to fix The file is corrupt and cannot be opened

How to get rid of corrupted files
How to repair The file is corrupted and cannot be opened.
The file is visible but cannot be opened.
I can view the file, but I can't open it.
How to repair The file is corrupted and  cannot be opened.
responses: Perform a check disk on the hard drive. Running this tool scans the hard drive and attempts to recover bad sectors.
Use the CHKDSK command. This is the command version of the tool we looked at above.
Use the SFC /scannow command. This command aims to find and repair corrupt Windows system files.
Change the file format. Use a free file converter app, or open the file with any application that automatically converts from other file formats.
Use file repair software. If you're desperate to fix the file and recover your information, try a file repair utility.
